Key Match Events: Javier Aguirre’s third stint in charge of the Mexico Men’s National Team began with a statement 3-0 win over New Zealand on Saturday.
Orbelin Pineda scored Mexico’s first goal in less than five minutes after New Zealand failed to clear the ball in the box.
Cesar Huerta doubled Mexico's lead early in the second half with a right-footed shot after being on the pitch for only about 60 seconds.
Luis Romo scored Mexico’s third goal with a shot from outside the box.
New Zealand registered their first effort on target in the 70th minute via Matthew Garbett.
